CatDescriptText: Mr. Leroy Gaines, custodian, East Liberty and Mr. Chester Schultz, bus driver, Bethel Borough, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column, published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 25, 1961, pg. B1 with question: "Do you think Federal aid to schools should be granted to parochial as well as public schools?" Mr. Gaines' answer reads: "I think it should because education is necessary for those youngsters the same as it is for colored adn white students."  Mr. Schultz's answer reads: "They are paying taxes the same as we, therefore, they should get aid."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of Leroy Gaines wearing plaid cap and light colored zippered wool jacket, standing on sidewalk with Bar-B-Q restaurant in background, Downtown; Portrait of Chester Schultz wearing light colored fedora with dark band and eyeglasses, standing in front of building, Downtown
